Now we can tweak our prompt a bit to get it to draw some conclusions and write more interesting summaries. I wonder how much of this comes from its great knowledge and how much from the data in the prompt. I guess using simulated election data solves that problem pretty well. https://t.co/OB8oeNcQJn

I grabbed the state-level election results as a csv from MIT and copied some columns directly into my prompt. Now it's actually generating summaries based on real election data (haven't fact-checked any of its claims or math) https://t.co/Eid4ASZBaC
So far I've just been feeding it randomized data with fake candidates from my election simulation notebook, but what if we feed it real state-level results? https://t.co/JHxAInvHSM
Now that it sort of knows what I want it to do, you can tweak the prompt a bit to get it to turn out different tones of the same information https://t.co/IrriCklrg4
I had to tell it how to declare a winner and now it seems to be doing a better job https://t.co/qXd3ko9RsG
GPT-3 knows not only how to read JSON, but also how to add some flare- however, it does not seem to be mathematician https://t.co/6sF9c9lNON

A surprise visit from @currankelleher at the end of the stream, we chatted a bit about updates to https://t.co/nxpdVU1W6y and how fun it was to work in public. I'm hopping off for now, thanks to everyone who stopped by! Gonna do this again soon https://t.co/60ZSJbfrAP

https://t.co/gjviroe8gR ü§ì coming back from a break in a second, planning to break a design into Vue components and string it up with our new simulated data, maybe if I feel fancy I will add some testing

Taking a quick break. So far we have the basics running. When I get back I want to build a script to grab fake election data from my notebook and show it as a table.
